casebody.data:
Linda M. AMES; Peggy West, Plaintiffs-Appellants, v. SUNRISE HOSPITAL, INC., Defendant-Appellee. No. 00-16593. D.C. No. CV-98-00929-HDM. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. Submitted Dec. 5, 2001.* Decided Dec. 19, 2001.

Before KOZINSKI, RYMER, and SILVERMAN, Circuit Judges.

The panel unanimously finds this case suitable for decision without oral argument. Fed. R.App. P. 34(a)(2).

MEMORANDUM **

Sunrise Hospital articulated nondiscriminatory reasons for firing appellants. Appellants failed to show “specific, substantial evidence” that those reasons were pretextual. Godwin v. Hunt Wesson, Inc., 150 F.3d 1217, 1221 (9th Cir.1998).

AFFIRMED.

This disposition is not appropriate for publication and may not be cited to or by the *872courts of this circuit except as provided by 9th Cir. R. 36-3.
